# Introduction

In this short article I demonstrate how to generate beautiful plots using a number of packages in R.

```{r echo=FALSE}
annotation <- base::data.frame(x = 4.5, y = 35,
                   label = c(glue()))

gapminder |>
  select(continent, lifeExp) |>
  ggplot(aes(continent, lifeExp)) +
  stat_halfeye(
    adjust = .5,
    width = .6,
    .width = 0,
    justification = -.2,
    point_color = NA,
    aes(fill = continent)
  ) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .12, outlier.shape = NA) +
  stat_dots(
    side = 'left',
    justification = 1.1,
    binwidth = 0.5,
    aes(col = continent)
  ) +
  geom_richtext(
    data = annotation,
    aes(x = x, y = y, label = label),
    color = 'orange',
    size = 7,
    angle = 0,
    fontface = 'bold'
  ) +
  labs(
    title = 'Distribution of life expectancy across fibe continents',
    subtitle = 'Between 1952 and 2007',
    caption = paste0(
      'Source: Data from gapminder, Version ',
      packageVersion('gapminder')
    ),
    x = 'Continent',
    y = 'Life expectancy (years)'
  ) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0.6, NA)) +
  theme_classic() +
  theme(legend.position = 'none',
        text = element_text(size = 20)) 
```
